Articles.Content: It is too laggy to play (it is just a 1,200 part shuttle...)

My Elcano Challenge

I think I can I think I can I think I can I think I can...

Just trying not to think about when the next update will arrive..... But the fact that im here and read the above posts = that I could not stay away... Well guess I have to kill the time with some of the other fantastic games out there ;-)

ps. Thinking about trying the Kerbal Linux 64bit version.. ( might change to linux in the future ).
Nothing really, I feel pretty burnt out on the game, so I'll just wait. Playing War Thunder in the meantime.
Homework and breaking the Mac 32X version on purpose. Turns out my computer can have ~500 parts in action if I restart LOTS. Cue me starting massive naval battles...

Two words...

Rebel Galaxy!

JR

Honestly I felt bored after ~40hr playing that. It's not bad, but after getting a top-tier ship/equips there's nothing really attractive any more, and some small weird but annoying issues stopped me spending more than trivial amount of time on it. I'm still back on 1.0.4 until 1.0.5/1.1, I guess.

I think I'm going to freeze at 1.0.4, at least until the mods I'm currently using all update, and I'll keep playing New Horizons.

However, TBH with Fallout 4 coming out I don't think KSP is going to get very much of my time.
Screwing around with new SSTO designs.... but I really wish I had a new Mk3 cargo hatch to play with.... lol...
I'm just waiting for 1.05.

I'm going to try to get through all the SETI contracts and advanced progression contracts, with some other contract packs as well, lIke scansat. Shut off a lot the stock contracts to get rid of all the contracts I hate doing that just get in the way of the good stuff. Makes for a much better career at least so far. Figure 1.1 will be ready by the time I've more or else finished the career. Then I can start all over.
Saving up money to plug in an extra 8GB of RAM and install all the mods I want
Wondering how they can announce 1.0.5 as an extra version that will arrive shortly, since 1.1 is postponed, and then use another month on launching it.

I've been wondering what to do myself. I've been to all the planets, finishing with an anywhere-but-Eve mining ship tour. I've maxed the tech tree and have 10mil in the bank.

Normally I have lots going on simultaneously (thanks kerbal alarm clock) but that's not good over an upgrade so I have pulled in all my manned missions and am waiting for something cool to come along in a new version.

My promotion at work requires me to learn some Linux, so now that I'm getting paid for it, I spent the weekend setting up Ubuntu as part of a dual-boot system, and thanks to a lot of forum help, was able to get 64 bit KSP up and running with 86 glorious mods and only 1 crash over 36 hours of playing.

Now to get that work thing wrapped around play time.....

My promotion at work requires me to learn some Linux, so now that I'm getting paid for it, I spent the weekend setting up Ubuntu as part of a dual-boot system, and thanks to a lot of forum help, was able to get 64 bit KSP up and running with 86 glorious mods and only 1 crash over 36 hours of playing.

Now to get that work thing wrapped around play time.....

Great that you got into linux however I am doing the same on 64-bit Windows version of KSP which is rock solid. Putting this here just to spread the word. For details, see the 64-bit thread.

Right now, I am having a hard time to get motivated to play KSP. According to Steam, I have over 1400 hours, so I know it's not the game...or is it? I am hesitant to do anything, even in sandbox, knowing that I may be able to launch and save, but once 1.0.5 or 1.1.0 comes out, I might not be able to get back to that save and pick up where I left off. Does anyone else get the "waiting for the next update funk"?

Right now, I am having a hard time to get motivated to play KSP. According to Steam, I have over 1400 hours, so I know it's not the game...or is it? I am hesitant to do anything, even in sandbox, knowing that I may be able to launch and save, but once 1.0.5 or 1.1.0 comes out, I might not be able to get back to that save and pick up where I left off. Does anyone else get the "waiting for the next update funk"?

In that situation I do shorter term stuff, like challenges, and try out new mods.

I'm diving into UKS with USI-LS and Near Future Technologies. I was totally against the complexity these mods would add, but the more I studied them the more I loved them.

Usually I start a new career when a new release comes out, but I am having too much fun to leave this save behind.

My OKS ship: https://imgur.com/gallery/elRqt/

Okay, played Factorio to death, still no KSP 1.1.

Saw a nice glider for X-Plane that's been tempting me. They mention a mod that has better thermals. Maybe I'll learn to fly gliders next.
I made a copy of the KSP folder and put it elsewhere so I can still fly my stuff...need to update the safe folder though...

I made a copy of the KSP folder and put it elsewhere so I can still fly my stuff...need to update the safe folder though...

In steam, I can make a folder, or in fact, copy the entire game, but cannot play it as a stand-alone. Does anyone have an idea around this? I'd love to have a game modded to the max and one vanilla game for the challenges...
That should have worked, there is no DRM even on the Steam version, so check your KSP.log and output_log.txt for the issue.
Waiting for 1.1

What am I doing while waiting for 1.1/1.0.5?

Waiting for 7 Days to Die Alpha 13~

In steam, I can make a folder, or in fact, copy the entire game, but cannot play it as a stand-alone. Does anyone have an idea around this? I'd love to have a game modded to the max and one vanilla game for the challenges...

I still do that when new releases come in. I own both versions (Steam and Squad Store), but the Squad Store tends to be a little slow on release day (although it's been better in the 1.0 era than pre-1.0), so I usually just branch off from the Steam version (which, as it happens, is on sale right now) for the first few days. As sal_vager says, there's no DRM on it (yay!), plus it loads all assets from a relative path, so it's highly compatible with that sort of installation.

Are you starting it from the KSP.exe (I've heard that the launcher doesn't work so well these days, never used it to be honest)? Are the permissions okay?
Not really playing any games lately. Will get "Obduction" when it comes out.
